# Dinas Couture

Welcome to the Dinas Couture project! This is a fashion website designed to showcase and sell a variety of clothing and accessories.

## Project Structure

The project is organized as follows:

```
dinas-couture
├── src
│   ├── components
│   │   ├── Header.tsx        # Header component with logo and navigation
│   │   ├── Footer.tsx        # Footer component with copyright and social links
│   │   ├── ProductCard.tsx   # Component to display individual product details
│   │   └── Navigation.tsx     # Navigation component for site links
│   ├── pages
│   │   ├── Home.tsx          # Landing page showcasing featured products
│   │   ├── Products.tsx      # Page displaying all available products
│   │   ├── Product.tsx       # Detailed view of a specific product
│   │   ├── Cart.tsx          # Shopping cart page for managing selected items
│   │   └── Checkout.tsx      # Checkout process page for user information and payment
│   ├── styles
│   │   └── globals.css       # Global CSS styles for the website
│   ├── types
│   │   └── index.ts          # TypeScript interfaces and types
│   └── app.tsx               # Entry point of the application
├── public
│   └── favicon.ico           # Favicon for the website
├── package.json              # npm configuration file
├── tsconfig.json             # TypeScript configuration file
├── .gitignore                # Git ignore file
└── README.md                 # Project documentation
```

## Getting Started

To get started with the Dinas Couture project, follow these steps:

1. **Clone the repository**:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/ifeanyisolomon004-bit/Solomon.git
   cd dinas-couture
   ```

2. **Install dependencies**:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Run the application**:
   ```bash
   npm start
   ```

## Features

- User-friendly interface for browsing and purchasing fashion items.
- Responsive design for optimal viewing on various devices.
- Secure checkout process with payment options.

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please feel free to submit a pull request or open an issue for any suggestions or improvements.
